text: local emergency services rushed to
respond to the deadly dawn attack on the
Garissa University College compound
masked gunmen had stormed the site
initially killing two guards on the gate
this region in eastern Kenya not far
from the border with strife-torn Somalia
has been the scene of numerous terror
attacks this new onslaught on the
university has come amid reports that
there had been local warnings that
another attack could be imminent relief
for some as a group of students emerge
from hiding they talked of the gunmen
firing indiscriminately there are fears
now for an unknown number of hostages he
had some gunshot and he was sleeping so
it was around
I don't faith and guys set it jumping up
and down around him for their lives but
it's unfortunate that our where they
were going to is where their gunshots
were coming from meanwhile the local
hospital has been coping with many
injured mainly from gunshot wounds
you're working to deploy more surgeons
just to beef up the medical operation
like ongoing I think he didn't want to
be caught off guard until we'd rather
have as much of the medical team on the
ground so that there they can believe
any eventual appease as in London Kerr
watchfully anxiously the police lay in
wait as the standoff continued gunfire
and explosions were heard at the campus
the police talked of a fierce exchange
with the gunmen the Somali Islamist
group al-shabaab linked to al-qaeda has
now said it's behind the attack most
spectacularly it was also behind the
storming of the Westgate shopping centre
in Nairobi in 2013 which spread panic
and left 67 dead al-shabaab targeted
Kenya after Kenyan troops were sent into
Somalia to help fight the group there
and the fallout from this new attack
reach far beyond the shocked community
of Garissa Nick Child's BBC news
